description:

Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Logitech is shutting down all POP Smart Home buttons and hubs, giving users less than three weeks’ notice before they stop working entirely. Linus and Luke tear into how this kind of cloud-locked “smart” hardware traps customers, why a 15% discount isn’t compensation, and how companies should handle product end-of-life the right way.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVHXYqMPyzc

► GET MERCH: https://lttstore.com
► GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE: https://lmg.gg/lttfloatplane
► SPONSORS, AFFILIATES, AND PARTNERS: https://lmg.gg/partners
title: Logitech, This Is Embarrassing

A fire destroyed over 850 terabytes of South Korean government data after officials failed to back up their main “G Drive” system. Linus and Luke break down how poor infrastructure and cost-cutting led to the loss, discuss reports of potential negligence and corruption, and highlight why real off-site backups are non-negotiable, even for governments.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVHXYqMPyzc

title: They Lost 858TB of Data

Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Microsoft insists new Xbox hardware is still in development, even after canceling its rumored handheld over sales concerns. But the real headline is the reported ad-supported free tier of Game Pass, which Linus and Luke argue could push gaming further into mobile-style monetization. They discuss what this means for Xbox’s future, the death of console innovation, and how ad-driven incentives could make games worse for everyone.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVHXYqMPyzc

title: Xbox Isn't Dead

Ford has started locking basic features like navigation and driver assist behind paid subscriptions, joining BMW, Mercedes, and others in nickel-and-diming car owners. Linus and Luke call out how this model strips away ownership, question GM’s decision to drop Android Auto and CarPlay, and talk about how car subscriptions are turning into the worst trend in tech.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVHXYqMPyzc
